subject: Re: help-I broke my box
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Hey LC... Okay now you have both models and because of that... you 
are an official memeber of the Dynamic Duo Radio Shack Hack Club.  
Welcome!!!

And to boot, since your 12-470 has shorter battery leads, your 
batteries will no doubt last longer than mine because your electrons 
will not have as far to travel to the radio, where mine will tire out 
sooner with that extra length of copper... ;-)

- Mike

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@...> wrote:
>
> OK - I just received my used 12-470 older version radio today and 
> hacked it in about 10 minutes.  Works great, BUT I noticed on mine 
> the length of the battery wires were not as generous as on Mike's 
> video or the 12-469 I hacked previously.  Thus, I had to sort of 
keep 
> it almost together, peering deep inside with a magnifying glass to 
> make sure I had the correct wire (7th from top - green for this 
one) 
> and somehow snip it.  
> 
> I guess I am reporting this, because you really have to pay 
attention 
> to the length of the battery box wires when you tear into these - 
> they do vary, and are easy to accidentally detach off of the board.
> 
> LC
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Ron Lederer <ronriko@> wrote:
> >
> > So dummy here couldn't even follow Mike's great video 
instructions 
> with the RS12-469.  After driving two hours to Merida, Mexico and 
> then back and putting down 600 pesos (about $55 dollars) it took me 
> ten minutes to do everything UFO Geek laid out in his video for 
> hacking the radio shack box.  Cut the right pin labeled mute.  
Closed 
> the box nicely.  Nothing.  Reopened the box...looked around...two 
> times more...still nothing.   Not even a light or hum.  
> >    
> >   Until I figure the radio thing out, I am in the mean time 
getting 
> nowhere (it seems) with the EVP Maker on my computer to generate 
EVP 
> noise and using my hand recorder etc.   Wish I could try the radio 
> sistem...any real geeks who can give technical suggestions would be 
> greatly appreciated.  Or maybe I should just throw away my 469 and 
> start over.   Dont think RS will take it back.     geek-wanna-be, 
Ron 
> L
> > 
> >        
> > ---------------------------------
> > Never miss a thing.   Make Yahoo your homepage.
> >
>
